newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia coconut oil stable, copra easier.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia coconut oil stable, copra easier.

text.p: Indonesian coconut oil prices were generally stable on Friday, while copra was easier on ample supply, traders said.
They said RBD coconut oil was quoted at 1,920 rupiah/kg in Jakarta, unchanged from a week ago, while copra was down at 860 rupiah/kg from 900 rupiah/kg.
"The market is stable, with demand from refineries producing cooking oil remaining good," one trader said. "There has not been much problem with the weather, despite some rain."
Traders said they expected coconut oil prices to undergo a correction next week, following falls in Europe overnight.
Coconut oil closed with sellers $7.50 to $12.50 down after March/April traded at $750 per tonne cif Rotterdam.
Indonesian traders said, however, they were hoping an expected strengthening of coconut oil prices in the Philippines due to rains would lift local sentiment.
Indonesia is the world's second largest coconut producer after the Philippines, and exporters often look to Manila for price direction.
